title: Swim –– With Care of Your Stables
body:
In this article we will analyze Swim protocol by decomposing it into small simple pieces. Also, you’ll get answers to the questions:

* Is there anything better?
* How decentralized is it?
* How secure?
* What perspectives?

I don’t want to waste time, so let’s start step-by-step.

## Contents

**PART 1 – What and what’s for?  
 PART 2 – How does it work?**  
 Diving deeper  
 Backstage magic  
 **PART 3 – The exact “but”**  
 Decentralization  
 Security  
 **PART 4 – Comparing to competitors**  
 deBridge  
 Rango Exchange  
 Zapper  
 Let’s sum-up a little bit  
 **PART 5 – Endgame  
 PART 6 – Tokenomics  
 PART 7 – Final sum-up**

## PART 1 – What and what’s for?

**Swim protocol** — is AMM (Automated Market Maker) cross-chain bridge for stables\*. Do you remember the time you were searching for the exact bridge to find the exact pair of chains and ending with thoughts “Maybe it’s cheaper to swap through Binance?”. Say no more! This protocol solves this problem once and forever – cheap, fast and easy, as you love. But it can’t be that good, can it? Let’s go into it.

\**The team plans to supplement various uncommon cross-chain swap pairs, such as ETH/SOL.*

## PART 2 – How does it work?

Let’s start with basic ideas smoothly going to more detailed explanation.

> If you get stuck with such terms as validators, smart contracts and others, check the previous [article](https://mirror.xyz/macevoy.eth/Gfk-iDyjxPMOkSWu7h27f1gW70tx7hn86Iag0-5iXlg) out.

As mentioned, the protocol is based on AMM smart contract with personal pool of stables called **Hexapool**. In other words – liquidity pool, which contains USDC, USDT & BUSD on various chains: BNB chain, Solana, Ethereum, Avalanche, Fantom, Aurora, Polygon and even Karura – impressed tbh. The list is gonna be extended.

Still, the main role plays **Wormhole**, above what Swim is actually built. It contains the most interesting and contradictory parts.

What’s Wormhole btw? Essentially, it’s a cross-chain **SDK** (Software Development Kit). In simple words – a ready-to-use set of tools for building multi-chain applications. Its goal is to provide accessibility to data, applications and tokens among large number of blockchains. And here is a point why I put tokens to the end of the sentence. Wormhole is not just a usual exchange, but fundament for building. I’m not gonna prescribe it in deep details, so if you’re interested, [check this introduction and video](https://docs.wormholenetwork.com/wormhole/). I just wanna mention Wormhole’s bridge called **Portal**. Its idea lies in collateral – native tokens are locked on the EVM chain, while wrapped tokens are proportionally minted on Solana. And vice versa – wrapped tokens are burnt while native tokens are unlocked.

### Diving deeper

The Swim team has been repeatedly telling us about protocol’s specific – as a result of swap we get **native tokens** on the destination chain, instead of wrapped ones. The algorithm is pretty simple (example of BUSD BNB Chain ——> USDT Solana):

1. You send BUSD by approving transactions.
2. Swim’s smart contract sends the tokens to Wormhole which locks them on the initial chain (in this example BNB Chain) and, as a follow-on, wrapped tokens are minted on Solana.
3. The smart contract gets these wrapped tokens from Wormhole, assess the slippage and the price the swap performed with.
4. The last step – wrapped tokens are exchanged for the native tokens in Swim’s liquidity pool and sent to your wallet.

As a result, you get USDT on Solana.

As I said, pretty simple, huh? The secret is in simplicity! In the example above I prescribed a light-touch logic with the jammy selected swap pair. But do you still remember how many chains are supported? In practice there should be more approvals and swaps to be performed. It results in series of 8-12 actions which, I have to admit, is not so comfortable for a user. But at the end of the article you’ll find some good news about it.

### Backstage magic

Due to the fact that the main computations and transactions are held on Solana, we get such low commissions and fast processing time. Even if we intend to send our stables from Polygon to BNB Chain (EVM —> EVM), it still uses Wormhole’s bridge and its wrapped tokens. As a consequence, you still need a Solana wallet to approve transactions and pay a fee. Check the example below:

![Example of EVM to EVM swap on Swim](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1DJ2App_Lp-pY0BT-ZwDs.jpg?height=1238&width=1400)

## PART 3 – The exact “but”

In this section we will talk about decentralization and security.

### Decentralization

As Wormhole is a key component in Swim’s architecture, let’s talk about it in details.

Wormhole, in practice, is something between centralized and decentralized protocol. Data verification is carried out by the 19 public validators proudly called **Guardians** ~~of the galaxy~~. Its consensus mechanism is called **Proof-of-Authority** (PoA). In simple words – these validators check that the tokens locked on the initial chain are equal to the tokens minted on the destination chain (wrapped tokens on Solana). It becomes possible because of the Wormhole’s **Сore contracts** written on each supported blockchain, which are used to lock tokens. Moreover, each validator has its own node on each blockchain, so they can work in parallel and verify each other. As long as more than **2/3** of the validators agree that the correlation is right, the data seems verified.

The best and most reputable validators were selected to become Guardians, as “Worm team” [states](https://twitter.com/wormholecrypto/status/1527328237017128972). However, there is no any penalty system implemented, since they don’t stake any tokens to maintain the network. How decentralized it is – I leave you to decide.

### Security

The second “but” and likely the last one.

Just straight – **93,750 ETH were** [stollen](https://wormholecrypto.medium.com/wormhole-incident-report-02-02-22-ad9b8f21eec6) from Wormhole due to the hack. Honorable fund Jump Сrypto finally compensated the whole amount, but I guess there is still a trace. What changed since then, and how do both teams work on security? Firstly, they announced public [bug bounty program](https://wormholecrypto.medium.com/wormhole-launches-bug-bounty-program-on-immunefi-with-10-million-reward-for-critical-bugs-65df15eacd71) with a price up to **10kk$** soon after the hack. Secondly, I asked several questions to the Swim team in order to figure it out:

*– Let's imagine the situation where Wormhole got fully compromised or just shut off. What would you do? Do you have any plan in case of such emergency?*

***– We have a live heartbeat of the Wormhole’s Guardian network and a live scrapping of the collateral held vs the market cap of each Wormhole’s wrapped token. All this gives us the most up-to-date status of the Wormhole’s Guardian network. We are alerted for any irregularities and positioned to pause during an emergency.***

*– Since the featured hack of Wormhole in Feb, were there any additional measures taken to increase security?*

***– Yes, we have staged code pushes to prevent the exact lead time the hacker had. We can much stronger monitor any suspicious behavior. In particular, collateral backed vs market cap of Wormhole’s wrapped tokens would have triggered. And we have public bug bounties.***

Fairly talking – each DeFi protocol can be hacked in theory. That’s the matter of probability. I guess that’s why we use minimum a couple of wallets, remove unnecessary approvals and don’t keep all eggs in the same basket. Right???

**Pros:**

**Cons:**

### Rango Exchange

Particularly, comparison with [Rango Exchange](https://app.rango.exchange/swap/) is pretty valuable since it is an aggregator of various bridges with 40 supported chains. Some kind of 1inch but in cross-chain swaps.

![Comparison of Rango Exchange & Swim – USDT on Ethereum —> BUSD on BNB Chain](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_ZjnsB6jNIltAxOpUR_YD.jpg?height=1500&width=2738&&size=medium)

title: Modular Application-Specific Chains
body:
The majority of Decentralized Applications available today are built with smart contracts deployed on top of existing blockchains (Ethereum, Avalanche, Solana, etc.). Smart contracts built on the same blockchains would then be part of a shared environment. In this article I want to touch up on why this can be better improved upon.

### Shortcomings

Building complex decentralized applications using smart contracts deployed on top of existing blockchains isn’t perfect, and could even be considered as sub-optimal. Here’s why:

* **Lack of Flexibility**

  dApps are often developed with a specific blockchain in mind, and thus a specific programming language and virtual machine. The dApp would then be limited to the capabilities of the underlying blockchain itself. For example, dApps built on the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) would inherit whatever limitations the EVM has.
* **Lack of Sovereignty**

  dApps that run on a shared environment face limited sovereignty. For example, if the devs or community wanted to do a fork or upgrade the smart contract, they would have to coordinate with and depend upon the underlying blockchain’s governance.
* **Sub-Optimal Performance**

  All dApps in the same blockchain are run by the same Virtual Machine. These smart contracts would then have to compete and “fight” with each other for an allocation of resources from the VM, which would then constrain the VM itself, limiting its performance, eventually leading to issues in gas and network usability

Application-specific blockchains addresses these shortcomings.


---

### Application-Specific Blockchains

Application-Specific Chains are customized blockchains made for one specific decentralized application.

In this article, I’ll be talking about **modular** app-specific blockchains in particular

They are built using modular architecture where the consensus and Data Availability functions are separated from the Execution function. An example of modular app-specific chains would be app-specific chains built on [Celestia](https://celestia.org/). A more in-depth dicussion on Celestia and modular architecture can be found in this article:

[https://mirror.xyz/knarb.eth/idZOlUKqxpFgs1mp22PJ4e7ismHquAY2hPyYUjk2i5A](https://mirror.xyz/knarb.eth/idZOlUKqxpFgs1mp22PJ4e7ismHquAY2hPyYUjk2i5A)

*Why modular app-specific chains?*

Traditional app-specific chains requires you to build every part of your own customized blockchain, that would mean building every single component including consensus, execution and data availability from the ground up. This requires a lot of resources.

For modular app-specific blockchains, you’d only need to build the execution layer which you can plug into Celestia for the consensus and data availability layers.

This saves time, resources and costs while providing the benefits that Celestia itself offers.


---

### Addressing Shortcomings

On top of the improved scalability and resource efficiency, modular app-specific blockchains also address the shortcomings of building on a shared environment and have a multitude of other pros

With modular app-specific blockchains that live natively on a data availability layer, such is the case by using Celestia, devs can build custom virtual machines with any network in mind. Cosmos SDK, Substrate, Weave, anything they want, it's their choice. This immediately solves the first problem previously mentioned, flexibility.

Since dApps on modular app-specific blockchains are not reliant on a shared environment’s governance, devs and the community would have significantly greater authority and sovereignty. They would not have to wait for an approval from an underlying blockchain’s governance if they wanted to make a decision. For example, if devs or the community wanted to fork or upgrade their dApp, modular app-specific chains allows you to do this without having to wait for any underlying blockchain’s governance. An example of this would be how dApps on Celestia would not need consent from Celestia itself if they wanted to do a fork, therefore solving the sovereignty problem.

Modular app-specific chains allows a dApp to maximize its performance without having to worry about the constraints of its underlying environment. dApps on a modular app-specific chain would never have to compete for an allocation of resources on they’re blockchain, unlike on a shared environment.


---

### Cross-Chain Communication

Cross-chain communication is the exchanging, reading and writing of data between different chains. Another word for it would be multi-chain interoperability. It’s how different chains like Ethereum, Solana and Avalanche are able communicate and interact with each other.

A benefit of modular app-specific chains is **trust-minimized** cross-chain communication between “clusters”

Clusters are groups of chains that perform trust-minimized communication

Every chain can perform cross-chain communication, whether it’s Ethereum to Solana, Ethereum to Polygon, Solana to Avalanche, etc. This is done by using trust assumptions, where you assume and trust that the chain and bridge you are communicating with is honest, reliable and will not steal your funds. This entire process is what’s called **trust-based** communication and poses some security risks as you are dependent on the honesty and reliability of the chain you are communicating with. Here’s a simple illustration to help you get a better understanding of this concept.

![Trust-based communication](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/X86C3MNY0R_5mYCVFjHBL.png?height=438&width=819)

Let’s use a case study of bridging between Ethereum and Polygon. When you bridge from Ethereum to Polygon, your funds will flow from the Ethereum chain to a bridge, then into the Polygon chain. See how, in this entire process, you are trusting the Polygon-Ethereum bridge to keep your funds safe and to not steal your funds. This process is **trust-based** as the bridge is a committee-based bridge which uses trust assumptions that require an honest **majority** assumption to sign off on communication. This poses a big security problem because you are exposing your funds to the bridge and in a worst case scenario, your funds get stolen.

Now, there is another type of communication called **trust-minimized** communication. This is a type of communication that requires weaker trust assumptions, meaning that it uses an honest **minority** assumption instead. This would mean that in the case of a dishonest majority in a committee-based bridge, the bridge can still continue to facilitate valid communication. There will then be significantly less security risk or risk that your funds will be stolen.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3dBkco_i0Nuz3wLhpuLmy.png?height=449&width=830)

Now let’s use a case study of bridging between Ethereum and a rollup like Arbitrum. Say you want to bridge your funds from Ethereum Mainnet into Arbitrum. Since the main chain (Ethereum) assumes that the transaction is valid, but can also use fraud proofs to indirectly validate the transactions of the rollup (Arbitrum), then you wouldn’t need any trust assumptions for your funds to be safe.

A while back I mentioned about Clusters

So Ethereum and rollups like Arbitrum, Optimism and zkSync would be one cluster as they communicate with trust-minimized communication. Meanwhile, Ethereum and Polygon are 2 separate clusters as they communicate with each other using trust-based communication (trust assumptions). For a more in-depth explanation on clusters, you can refer to this article:

[https://blog.celestia.org/clusters/](https://blog.celestia.org/clusters/)

Now this obviously poses a problem because communication between different chains like Ethereum to Polygon, Ethereum to Solana, Ethereum to Cosmos, Cosmos to Polygon, etc. uses trust-based communication which has weaker security guarantees as it requires more trust assumptions. 

So, this is what the current landscape of cross-chain communication looks like:

![Current landscape of cross-chain communication](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tHFlxNuTjUVYOVLfvoP7y.png?height=559&width=843)

You see how since Ethereum and its rollups communicate with each other with trust-minimized communication, they are in one cluster. That cluster then uses trust-based cross-chain communication when communicating with other chains like Polygon

*How can cross-chain communication be trust-minimized in order to reduce security risks?*

Any rollup or blockchain that shares a common data availability layer can make trust-minimized bridges with each other, either by fraud proofs, validity proofs or by directly validating the transactions, and a data availability layer is something that Celestia specializes in.

Celestia is a pluggable consensus and data availability layer, meaning that rollups or blockchains that want trust-minimized cross-chain communication can plug their execution layer onto Celestia, and *voilà*, enjoy trust-minimized cross-chain communication.

Here’s what the landscape of cross-chain communication in the future could look like with Celestia:

![Future landscape of cross-chain communication](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/s6qE5Z_d_RncDuZzVGlVu.png?height=588&width=829)

Celestia has the potential to become the core foundation for shared security and trust-minimized interoperability and communication between thousands, if not millions of rollups and blockchains in the future.


---

## Ending Note

By building on existing monolithic blockchains, the flexibility, sovereignty, performance and security of a dApp is far from optimal. Blockchains that communicate using trust-based assumptions relying on honest majority assumptions are flawed and face major security risks.

Modular app-specific chains that rely on trust-minimized cross-chain communication solves this by not only improving upon security, but by also significantly reducing the risk of funds being stolen.


---

*Thanks for reading! And a thank you to [Alex Beckett](https://twitter.com/likebeckett) and [Nick White](https://twitter.com/nickwh8te) for helping with proofreading! If you want to get notified about future posts or give any input/feedback, [subscribe](https://mirror.xyz/knarb.eth) and follow me on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_knarb). Or don’t. It’s up to you.*

*This article was first published on 8 February 2022 in Substack. Minor edits were made for formatting. Thank you and goodbye.*

title: SeeDAO治理工程师第13题-SeeDAO社区金库管理(上)
body:
本文分成上下文，上文先回顾了加密世界中DAO金库的起源和发展。下文针对SeeDAO金库目前的当前状况和遇到问题，提出一些建议和意见。


---

## 一.DAO金库的起源

2013年，最早线上分布式公司，DAC(Distributed Autonomous Corporation)概念由Daniel Larimer(EOS，Bitshare创始人) [最先提出](https://letstalkbitcoin.com/is-bitcoin-overpaying-for-false-security)。

2014年5月，在此基础上，V神特意写了一篇博文，发布在以太坊基金会官方博客上《[DAOs, DACs, DAs and More: An Incomplete Terminology Guide](https://blog.ethereum.org/2014/05/06/daos-dacs-das-and-more-an-incomplete-terminology-guide/)》。

**直到2016年4月，DAO金库正式出现。**

在Slock.it团队主要成员策划下，以太坊主网上首个风险投资型DAO诞生，背后理念就是用户投入Eth代币，换取The DAO的代币。DAO代币的作用，投票决定潜在项目方是否能被金库里的以太币投资。The DAO上线短短时间内，就筹集了价值1.5亿美元，数量超过1200万个Eth币。最后，因为一个代码漏洞，导致The DAO金库被盗和以太坊不得已硬分叉来解决这问题。

2017-2019年，[Aragon](https://twitter.com/AragonProject)、[DAOstack](https://daostack.io)、 [Moloch DAO](https://molochdao.com/)、[The LAO](https://www.thelao.io/)等好几个服务DAO的工具，DAO孵化器依旧在DAO路上不断探索。

2020年，DeFi Summer的出现，让蓝筹DeFi协议，如Uniswap, Maker, Compound收获了可观的手续费，充实了自家DAO金库，DAO金库的概念正式得以普及。

截至到2022年年，7月当前DAO金库控制的资金高达110亿美元各类资产。

![Source:https://pro.nansen.ai/dao-paradise](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iKfzhnkADMd8CG2YeNRyg.png?height=827&width=1590)

## 二.DAO金库的管理

随着DAO金库的不断壮大，如何更好的使用金库中的资产，成为了一个现实问题，不少DAO金库设置专人或者子DAO来管理庞大的社区金库资产。DAO金库的资产管理，方法论应运而生。

最重要的一篇研究文献，是2021年10月，Uncommoncore的Hasu发表的《一种用于DeFi国库的新的心智模型([a-new-mental-model-for-defi-treasuries](https://uncommoncore.co/a-new-mental-model-for-defi-treasuries/))》。

在文章中主要研究Maker DAO**低效的金库资产管理**：在Maker代币市场价格高企的时候，发大量资金回购MKR。当MKR币价低迷之时，被迫出售代币换取稳定币资产，完成不良资产清算。这样高买低卖，实际是对MKR代币长期价值的损害。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/I-UmdgDe2c7H9Iu46khbm.png?height=703&width=1116)

文章最后给出了一些DAO金库资产管理的建议：

* 金库资产管理，应该以最大化代币持有人的长期利益为主。
* 金库管理应该要考虑加密市场牛熊周期性
* 金库管理应该要逆币价周期调节，即牛市高卖，熊市低价回购
* 金库资产应该多元化，尤其是大部分金库资产都是原生Native Token，应该有足够的稳定币资产
* 金库资产投资，要尽量发挥每1美元最大效用，在选择回购，投资蓝筹加密资产（BTC，Eth），储蓄，或者给Token持有人分红。

## 三.DAO金库管理的发展

随着以太坊上DAO组织爆炸式发展，各种各样的DAO都涌现了出来，有风投DAO，游戏公会DAO，DeFi协议DAO，收藏家DAO，媒体DAO，生物研究类DAO等等。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lc994sr3eUPrprLh4bmAz.png?height=892&width=1587)

大量DAO出现，帮助新兴的DAO金库管理工具，也迎来了春天。比如DAO金库使用最多的多签工具-**[Genosis](https://twitter.com/gnosisSafe)**。DAO金库每一笔开支花费，都要在**[Snapshot](https://twitter.com/SnapshotLabs)** 上发帖，成员投票通过确认。

* 指数化产品，帮助DAO金库一键式多样化金库资产：indexcoop, Set protocol, PieDAO
* 

## 四.结论

title: Swim –– With Care of Your Stables
body:
In this article we will analyze Swim protocol by decomposing it into small simple pieces. Also, you’ll get answers to the questions:

* Is there anything better?
* How decentralized is it?
* How secure?
* What perspectives?

I don’t want to waste time, so let’s start step-by-step.

## Contents

**PART 1 – What and what’s for? 
 PART 2 – How does it work? 
 **Diving deeper 
 Backstage magic
**PART 3 – The exact “but”**
Decentralization
Security
**PART 4 – Comparing to competitors**
deBridge
Rango Exchange
Zapper
Let’s sum-up a little bit
**PART 5 – Endgame**

## PART 1 – What and what’s for?

**Swim protocol** — is AMM (Automated Market Maker) cross-chain bridge for stables\*. Do you remember the time you were searching for the exact bridge to find the exact pair of chains and ending with thoughts “Maybe it’s cheaper to swap through Binance?”. Say no more! This protocol solves this problem once and forever – cheap, fast and easy, as you love. But it can’t be that good, can it? Let’s go into it.

\**The team plans to supplement various uncommon cross-chain swap pairs, such as ETH/SOL.*

## PART 2 – How does it work?

Let’s start with basic ideas smoothly going to more detailed explanation.

> If you get stuck with such terms as validators, smart contracts and others, check the previous [article](https://mirror.xyz/macevoy.eth/Gfk-iDyjxPMOkSWu7h27f1gW70tx7hn86Iag0-5iXlg) out.

As mentioned, the protocol is based on AMM smart contract with personal pool of stables called **Hexapool**. In other words – liquidity pool, which contains USDC, USDT & BUSD on various chains: BNB chain, Solana, Ethereum, Avalanche, Fantom, Aurora, Polygon and even Karura – impressed tbh. The list is gonna be extended.

Still, the main role plays **Wormhole**, above what Swim is actually built. It contains the most interesting and contradictory parts.

What’s Wormhole btw? Essentially, it’s a cross-chain **SDK** (Software Development Kit). In simple words – a ready-to-use set of tools for building multi-chain applications. Its goal is to provide accessibility to data, applications and tokens among large number of blockchains. And here is a point why I put tokens to the end of the sentence. Wormhole is not just a usual exchange, but fundament for building. I’m not gonna prescribe it in deep details, so if you’re interested, [check this introduction and video](https://docs.wormholenetwork.com/wormhole/). I just wanna mention Wormhole’s bridge called **Portal**. Its idea lies in collateral – native tokens are locked on the EVM chain, while wrapped tokens are proportionally minted on Solana. And vice versa – wrapped tokens are burnt while native tokens are unlocked.

### Diving deeper

The Swim team has been repeatedly telling us about protocol’s specific – as a result of swap we get **native tokens** on the destination chain, instead of wrapped ones. The algorithm is pretty simple (example of BUSD BNB Chain ——> USDT Solana):

1. You send BUSD by approving transactions.
2. Swim’s smart contract sends the tokens to Wormhole which locks them on the initial chain (in this example BNB Chain) and, as a follow-on, wrapped tokens are minted on Solana.
3. The smart contract gets these wrapped tokens from Wormhole, assess the slippage and the price the swap performed with.
4. The last step – wrapped tokens are exchanged for the native tokens in Swim’s liquidity pool and sent to your wallet.

As a result, you get USDT on Solana.

As I said, pretty simple, huh? The secret is in simplicity! In the example above I prescribed a light-touch logic with the jammy selected swap pair. But do you still remember how many chains are supported? In practice there should be more approvals and swaps to be performed. It results in series of 8-12 actions which, I have to admit, is not so comfortable for a user. But at the end of the article you’ll find some good news about it.

### Backstage magic

Due to the fact that the main computations and transactions are held on Solana, we get such low commissions and fast processing time. Even if we intend to send our stables from Polygon to BNB Chain (EVM —> EVM), it still uses Wormhole’s bridge and its wrapped tokens. As a consequence, you still need a Solana wallet to approve transactions and pay a fee. Check the example below:

![Example of EVM to EVM swap on Swim](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1DJ2App_Lp-pY0BT-ZwDs.jpg?height=1238&width=1400)

## PART 3 – The exact “but”

In this section we will talk about decentralization and security.

### Decentralization

As Wormhole is a key component in Swim’s architecture, let’s talk about it in details.

Wormhole, in practice, is something between centralized and decentralized protocol. Data verification is carried out by the 19 public validators proudly called **Guardians** ~~of the galaxy~~. Its consensus mechanism is called **Proof-of-Authority** (PoA). In simple words – these validators check that the tokens locked on the initial chain are equal to the tokens minted on the destination chain (wrapped tokens on Solana). It becomes possible because of the Wormhole’s **Сore contracts** written on each supported blockchain, which are used to lock tokens. Moreover, each validator has its own node on each blockchain, so they can work in parallel and verify each other. As long as more than **2/3** of the validators agree that the correlation is right, the data seems verified.

The best and most reputable validators were selected to become Guardians, as “Worm team” [states](https://twitter.com/wormholecrypto/status/1527328237017128972). However, there is no any penalty system implemented, since they don’t stake any tokens to maintain the network. How decentralized it is – I leave you to decide.

### Security

The second “but” and likely the last one.

Just straight – **93,750 ETH were** [stollen](https://wormholecrypto.medium.com/wormhole-incident-report-02-02-22-ad9b8f21eec6) from Wormhole due to the hack. Honorable fund Jump Сrypto finally compensated the whole amount, but I guess there is still a trace. What changed since then, and how do both teams work on security? Firstly, they announced public [bug bounty program](https://wormholecrypto.medium.com/wormhole-launches-bug-bounty-program-on-immunefi-with-10-million-reward-for-critical-bugs-65df15eacd71) with a price up to **10kk$** soon after the hack. Secondly, I asked several questions to the Swim team in order to figure it out:

*– Let's imagine the situation where Wormhole got fully compromised or just shut off. What would you do? Do you have any plan in case of such emergency?*

***– We have a live heartbeat of the Wormhole’s Guardian network and a live scrapping of the collateral held vs the market cap of each Wormhole’s wrapped token. All this gives us the most up-to-date status of the Wormhole’s Guardian network. We are alerted for any irregularities and positioned to pause during an emergency.***

*– Since the featured hack of Wormhole in Feb, were there any additional measures taken to increase security?*

***– Yes, we have staged code pushes to prevent the exact lead time the hacker had. We can much stronger monitor any suspicious behavior. In particular, collateral backed vs market cap of Wormhole’s wrapped tokens would have triggered. And we have public bug bounties.***

Fairly talking – each DeFi protocol can be hacked in theory. That’s the matter of probability. I guess that’s why we use minimum a couple of wallets, remove unnecessary approvals and don’t keep all eggs in the same basket. Right???

## PART 4 – Comparing to competitors

In order to make this review more objective, let’s compare Swim to the other solutions. Below, I picked the most relevant bridges and aggregators:

### deBridge

A [cross-chain bridge](https://app.debridge.finance/deswap) with interesting architecture and own validators.

![Comparison of deBridge & Swim – BUSD on BNB Chain —> USDC on Polygon](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Keny8IZGe0OfE9vcSIGKB.jpg?height=1500&width=2979&&size=medium)

![Comparison of deBridge & Swim – USDT on Ethereum —> BUSD on BNB Chain](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/wuwo74Ats_AUh5JF0LY-i.jpg?height=1500&width=2979&&size=medium)

**Pros:** 
 – More decentralized solution  
 – Quite fast transactions

**Cons:** 
 – Small amount of supported chains (5 only)  
 – Absence of non-EVM chains – Bigger commissions

### Rango Exchange

Particularly, comparison with [Rango Exchange](https://app.rango.exchange/swap/) is pretty valuable since it is an aggregator of various bridges with 40 supported chains. Some kind of 1inch but in cross-chain swaps.

![Comparison of Rango Exchange & Swim – USDT on Ethereum —> BUSD on BNB Chain](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/_ZjnsB6jNIltAxOpUR_YD.jpg?height=1500&width=2738&&size=medium)

![Comparison of Rango Exchange & Swim – BUSD on BNB Chain —> USDC on Polygon](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rSFhYOBYoh5q0TAW2clk3.jpg?height=1500&width=2729&&size=medium)

**Pros:** 
 – Large amount of supported chains 
 – More decentralized solutions, generally

**Cons:** 
 – Bigger commissions with respect to the trading pair 
 – Slower transactions

### Zapper

[Bridge by Zapper](https://zapper.fi/bridge) – is an aggregator of various bridges, which sometimes provides pleasant conditions. Especially, due to integration of Biconomy’s bridge called [Hyphen Bridge](https://hyphen.biconomy.io/bridge):

![Comparison of Zapper & Swim – BUSD on BNB Chain —> USDC on Polygon](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/p3R3TNgGr0hGZfx8Gb9c6.jpg?height=1500&width=2613&&size=medium)

**Cons:**

Here are analogues which, imho, outdo Swim in relation of decentralization. However, this protocol takes essential place among the bests in such category as cross-chain swaps because of **EVM and non-EVM compatibility, fast transactions and low commissions**.

title: Modular Application-Specific Chains
body:
The majority of Decentralized Applications available today are built with smart contracts deployed on top of existing blockchains (Ethereum, Avalanche, Solana, etc.). Smart contracts built on the same blockchains would then be part of a shared environment. In this article I want to touch up on why this can be better improved upon.

### Shortcomings

Building complex decentralized applications using smart contracts deployed on top of existing blockchains isn’t perfect, and could even be considered as sub-optimal. Here’s why:

* **Lack of Flexibility**

  dApps are often developed with a specific blockchain in mind, and thus a specific programming language and virtual machine. The dApp would then be limited to the capabilities of the underlying blockchain itself. For example, dApps built on the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) would inherit whatever limitations the EVM has.
* **Lack of Sovereignty**

  dApps that run on a shared environment face limited sovereignty. For example, if the devs or community wanted to do a fork or upgrade the smart contract, they would have to coordinate with and depend upon the underlying blockchain’s governance.
* **Sub-Optimal Performance**

  All dApps in the same blockchain are run by the same Virtual Machine. These smart contracts would then have to compete and “fight” with each other for an allocation of resources from the VM, which would then constrain the VM itself, limiting its performance, eventually leading to issues in gas and network usability

Application-specific blockchains addresses these shortcomings.


---

### Application-Specific Blockchains

Application-Specific Chains are customized blockchains made for one specific decentralized application.

In this article, I’ll be talking about **modular** app-specific blockchains in particular

They are built using modular architecture where the consensus and Data Availability functions are separated from the Execution function. An example of modular app-specific chains would be app-specific chains built on [Celestia](https://celestia.org/). A more in-depth dicussion on Celestia and modular architecture can be found in this article:

[https://mirror.xyz/knarb.eth/idZOlUKqxpFgs1mp22PJ4e7ismHquAY2hPyYUjk2i5A](https://mirror.xyz/knarb.eth/idZOlUKqxpFgs1mp22PJ4e7ismHquAY2hPyYUjk2i5A)

*Why modular app-specific chains?*

Traditional app-specific chains requires you to build every part of your own customized blockchain, that would mean building every single component including consensus, execution and data availability from the ground up. This requires a lot of resources.

For modular app-specific blockchains, you’d only need to build the execution layer which you can plug into Celestia for the consensus and data availability layers.

This saves time, resources and costs while providing the benefits that Celestia itself offers.


---

### Addressing Shortcomings

On top of the improved scalability and resource efficiency, modular app-specific blockchains also address the shortcomings of building on a shared environment and have a multitude of other pros

With modular app-specific blockchains that live natively on a data availability layer, such is the case by using Celestia, devs can build custom virtual machines with any network in mind. Cosmos SDK, Substrate, Weave, anything they want, it's their choice. This immediately solves the first problem previously mentioned, flexibility.

Since dApps on modular app-specific blockchains are not reliant on a shared environment’s governance, devs and the community would have significantly greater authority and sovereignty. They would not have to wait for an approval from an underlying blockchain’s governance if they wanted to make a decision. For example, if devs or the community wanted to fork or upgrade their dApp, modular app-specific chains allows you to do this without having to wait for any underlying blockchain’s governance. An example of this would be how dApps on Celestia would not need consent from Celestia itself if they wanted to do a fork, therefore solving the sovereignty problem.

Modular app-specific chains allows a dApp to maximize its performance without having to worry about the constraints of its underlying environment. dApps on a modular app-specific chain would never have to compete for an allocation of resources on they’re blockchain, unlike on a shared environment.


---

### Cross-Chain Communication

Cross-chain communication is the exchanging, reading and writing of data between different chains. Another word for it would be multi-chain interoperability. It’s how different chains like Ethereum, Solana and Avalanche are able communicate and interact with each other.

A benefit of modular app-specific chains is **trust-minimized** cross-chain communication between “clusters”

Clusters are groups of chains that perform trust-minimized communication

Every chain can perform cross-chain communication, whether it’s Ethereum to Solana, Ethereum to Polygon, Solana to Avalanche, etc. This is done by using trust assumptions, where you assume and trust that the chain and bridge you are communicating with is honest, reliable and will not steal your funds. This entire process is what’s called **trust-based** communication and poses some security risks as you are dependent on the honesty and reliability of the chain you are communicating with. Here’s a simple illustration to help you get a better understanding of this concept.

![Trust-based communication](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/X86C3MNY0R_5mYCVFjHBL.png?height=438&width=819)

Let’s use a case study of bridging between Ethereum and Polygon. When you bridge from Ethereum to Polygon, your funds will flow from the Ethereum chain to a bridge, then into the Polygon chain. See how, in this entire process, you are trusting the Polygon-Ethereum bridge to keep your funds safe and to not steal your funds. This process is **trust-based** as the bridge is a committee-based bridge which uses trust assumptions that require an honest **majority** assumption to sign off on communication. This poses a big security problem because you are exposing your funds to the bridge and in a worst case scenario, your funds get stolen.

Now, there is another type of communication called **trust-minimized** communication. This is a type of communication that requires weaker trust assumptions, meaning that it uses an honest **minority** assumption instead. This would mean that in the case of a dishonest majority in a committee-based bridge, the bridge can still continue to facilitate valid communication. There will then be significantly less security risk or risk that your funds will be stolen.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3dBkco_i0Nuz3wLhpuLmy.png?height=449&width=830)

Now let’s use a case study of bridging between Ethereum and a rollup like Arbitrum. Say you want to bridge your funds from Ethereum Mainnet into Arbitrum. Since the main chain (Ethereum) assumes that the transaction is valid, but can also use fraud proofs to indirectly validate the transactions of the rollup (Arbitrum), then you wouldn’t need any trust assumptions for your funds to be safe.

A while back I mentioned about Clusters

So Ethereum and rollups like Arbitrum, Optimism and zkSync would be one cluster as they communicate with trust-minimized communication. Meanwhile, Ethereum and Polygon are 2 separate clusters as they communicate with each other using trust-based communication (trust assumptions). For a more in-depth explanation on clusters, you can refer to this article:

[https://blog.celestia.org/clusters/](https://blog.celestia.org/clusters/)

Now this obviously poses a problem because communication between different chains like Ethereum to Polygon, Ethereum to Solana, Ethereum to Cosmos, Cosmos to Polygon, etc. uses trust-based communication which has weaker security guarantees as it requires more trust assumptions. 

So, this is what the current landscape of cross-chain communication looks like:

![Current landscape of cross-chain communication](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tHFlxNuTjUVYOVLfvoP7y.png?height=559&width=843)

You see how since Ethereum and its rollups communicate with each other with trust-minimized communication, they are in one cluster. That cluster then uses trust-based cross-chain communication when communicating with other chains like Polygon

*How can cross-chain communication be trust-minimized in order to reduce security risks?*

Any rollup or blockchain that shares a common data availability layer can make trust-minimized bridges with each other, either by fraud proofs, validity proofs or by directly validating the transactions, and a data availability layer is something that Celestia specializes in.

Celestia is a pluggable consensus and data availability layer, meaning that rollups or blockchains that want trust-minimized cross-chain communication can plug their execution layer onto Celestia, and *voilà*, enjoy trust-minimized cross-chain communication.

Here’s what the landscape of cross-chain communication in the future could look like with Celestia:

![Future landscape of cross-chain communication](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/s6qE5Z_d_RncDuZzVGlVu.png?height=588&width=829)

Celestia has the potential to become the core foundation for shared security and trust-minimized interoperability and communication between thousands, if not millions of rollups and blockchains in the future.


---

## Ending Note

By building on existing traditional, monolithic blockchains, the flexibility, sovereignty, performance and security of a dApp is far from optimal. Blockchains that communicate using trust-based assumptions relying on honest majority assumptions are flawed and face major security risks.

Modular app-specific chains that rely on trust-minimized cross-chain communication solves this by not only improving upon security, but by also significantly reducing the risk of funds being stolen.


---

*Thanks for reading! And a thank you to [Alex Beckett](https://twitter.com/likebeckett) and [Nick White](https://twitter.com/nickwh8te) for helping with proofreading! If you want to get notified about future posts or give any input/feedback, [subscribe](https://mirror.xyz/knarb.eth) and follow me on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_knarb). Or don’t. It’s up to you.*

title: SeeDAO治理工程师第13题-SeeDAO社区金库管理(上)
body:
本文分成上下文，上文先回顾了加密世界中DAO金库的起源和发展。下文针对SeeDAO金库目前的当前状况和遇到问题，提出一些建议和意见。


---

## 一.DAO金库的起源

2013年，最早线上分布式公司，DAC(Distributed Autonomous Corporation)概念由Daniel Larimer(EOS，Bitshare创始人) [最先提出](https://letstalkbitcoin.com/is-bitcoin-overpaying-for-false-security)。

2014年5月，在此基础上，V神特意写了一篇博文，发布在以太坊基金会官方博客上《[DAOs, DACs, DAs and More: An Incomplete Terminology Guide](https://blog.ethereum.org/2014/05/06/daos-dacs-das-and-more-an-incomplete-terminology-guide/)》。

**直到2016年4月，DAO金库正式出现。**

在Slock.it团队主要成员策划下，以太坊主网上首个风险投资型DAO诞生，背后理念就是用户投入Eth代币，换取The DAO的代币。DAO代币的作用，投票决定潜在项目方是否能被金库里的以太币投资。The DAO上线短短时间内，就筹集了价值1.5亿美元，数量超过1200万个Eth币。最后，因为一个代码漏洞，导致The DAO金库被盗和以太坊不得已硬分叉来解决这问题。

2017-2019年，[Aragon](https://twitter.com/AragonProject)、[DAOstack](https://daostack.io)、 [Moloch DAO](https://molochdao.com/)、[The LAO](https://www.thelao.io/)等好几个服务DAO的工具，DAO孵化器依旧在DAO路上不断探索。

2020年，DeFi Summer的出现，让蓝筹DeFi协议，如Uniswap, Maker, Compound收获了可观的手续费，充实了自家DAO金库，DAO金库的概念正式得以普及。

截至到2022年年，7月当前DAO金库控制的资金高达110亿美元各类资产。

![Source:https://pro.nansen.ai/dao-paradise](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iKfzhnkADMd8CG2YeNRyg.png?height=827&width=1590)

## 二.DAO金库的管理

随着DAO金库的不断壮大，如何更好的使用金库中的资产，成为了一个现实问题，不少DAO金库设置专人或者子DAO来管理庞大的社区金库资产。DAO金库的资产管理，方法论应运而生。

最重要的一篇研究文献，是2021年10月，Uncommoncore的Hasu发表的《一种用于DeFi国库的新的心智模型([a-new-mental-model-for-defi-treasuries](https://uncommoncore.co/a-new-mental-model-for-defi-treasuries/))》。

在文章中主要研究Maker DAO**低效的金库资产管理**：在Maker代币市场价格高企的时候，发大量资金回购MKR。当MKR币价低迷之时，被迫出售代币换取稳定币资产，完成不良资产清算。这样高买低卖，实际是对MKR代币长期价值的损害。

![Case study:Maker DAO](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/I-UmdgDe2c7H9Iu46khbm.png?height=703&width=1116)

文章最后给出了一些DAO金库资产管理的建议：

* 金库资产管理，应该以最大化代币持有人的长期利益为主。
* 金库管理应该要考虑加密市场牛熊周期性
* 金库管理应该要逆币价周期调节，即牛市高卖，熊市低价回购
* 金库资产应该多元化，尤其是大部分金库资产都是原生Native Token，应该有足够的稳定币资产
* 金库资产投资，要尽量发挥每1美元最大效用，在选择回购，投资蓝筹加密资产（BTC，Eth），储蓄，或者给Token持有人分红。

## 三.DAO金库管理的发展

随着以太坊上DAO组织爆炸式发展，各种各样的DAO都涌现了出来，有风投DAO，游戏公会DAO，DeFi协议DAO，收藏家DAO，媒体DAO，生物研究类DAO等等。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lc994sr3eUPrprLh4bmAz.png?height=892&width=1587)

大量DAO出现，帮助新兴的DAO金库管理工具，也迎来了春天。比如DAO金库使用最多的多签工具-**[Genosis](https://twitter.com/gnosisSafe)**。DAO金库每一笔开支花费，都要在**[Snapshot](https://twitter.com/SnapshotLabs)** 上发帖，成员投票通过确认。

* 指数化产品，帮助DAO金库一键式多样化金库资产：[Indexcoop](https://twitter.com/indexcoop), [Set protocol](https://www.tokensets.com/), [PieDAO](https://twitter.com/PieDAO_DeFi)
* 

## 四.结论

2017-2019年，[Aragon](https://twitter.com/AragonProject)、[DAOstack](https://daostack.io)、 [Moloch DAO](https://molochdao.com/)、[The LAO](https://www.thelao.io/)等好几个服务DAO的工具，DAO孵化器依旧在DAO路上不断探索。

## 二.DAO金库的管理

随着DAO金库的不断壮大，如何更好的使用金库中的资产，成为了一个现实问题，不少DAO金库设置专人或者子DAO来管理庞大的社区金库资产。DAO金库的资产管理，方法论应运而生。

最重要的一篇研究文献，是2021年10月，Uncommoncore的Hasu发表的《一种用于DeFi国库的新的心智模型([a-new-mental-model-for-defi-treasuries](https://uncommoncore.co/a-new-mental-model-for-defi-treasuries/))》。

在文章中主要研究Maker DAO**低效的金库资产管理**：在Maker代币市场价格高企的时候，发大量资金回购MKR。当MKR币价低迷之时，被迫出售代币换取稳定币资产，完成不良资产清算。这样高买低卖，实际是对MKR代币长期价值的损害。

![Case study:Maker DAO](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/I-UmdgDe2c7H9Iu46khbm.png?height=703&width=1116)

* 金库资产管理，应该以最大化代币持有人的长期利益为主。
* 金库管理应该要考虑加密市场牛熊周期性
* 金库管理应该要逆币价周期调节，即牛市高卖，熊市低价回购
* 金库资产应该多元化，尤其是大部分金库资产都是原生Native Token，应该有足够的稳定币资产
* 金库资产投资，要尽量发挥每1美元最大效用，在选择回购，投资蓝筹加密资产（BTC，Eth），储蓄，或者给Token持有人分红。

随着以太坊上DAO组织爆炸式发展，各种各样的DAO都涌现了出来，有风投DAO，游戏公会DAO，DeFi协议DAO，收藏家DAO，媒体DAO，生物研究类DAO等等。

title: 20220730 - Vertical Farming, Space, Health AI and The Line
body:
**ENERGY:** Small modular reactors (SMRs) - nuclear reactor units that can output up to 300 megawatts of electricity and generate enough electricity to power approximately 230,000 homes a year. Not new, but after 6 years in the approval process, the US has just certified a design from NuScale. A possible future exists where we move past the massive and expensive nuclear projects to more decentralized local SMR implementations.

[https://arstechnica.com/science/2022/07/us-regulators-will-certify-first-small-nuclear-reactor-design/](https://arstechnica.com/science/2022/07/us-regulators-will-certify-first-small-nuclear-reactor-design/)

**AGRICULTURE:** World’s largest vertical farm just opened in Dubai (330,000 square feet). It has the capacity to produce over two million pounds of leafy greens annually and because it is indoors, doesn’t require pesticides. Vertical farms are clearly an important shift in agriculture that we will see more and more of as time goes on.

[https://singularityhub.com/2022/07/22/the-worlds-biggest-vertical-farm-just-opened-in-dubai/](https://singularityhub.com/2022/07/22/the-worlds-biggest-vertical-farm-just-opened-in-dubai/)

And speaking about vertical farming, I recently came across this vertical farm while at a trampoline park, of all places…

[https://twitter.com/jamiebeach/status/1551167537559248896?s=20&t=-Pil0Bm6Lv7U5TLagMq3nQ](https://twitter.com/jamiebeach/status/1551167537559248896?s=20&t=-Pil0Bm6Lv7U5TLagMq3nQ)

**HEALTH:** Ultrasounds typically require machines and specialists operating them at the clinic or hospical. But a new technique has been recently [published in Science](https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.abo2542) and reported on the The Guardian, where a “stick-on ultrasound patch” can be worn for up to 48 hours by a patient. The patch essentially streams ultrasound imaging of what’s under the skin, wirelessly, to the patient’s phone. Whether or not this actually sees the light of day, and without more details, conceptually this could be revolutionary for medical imaging.

[https://www.theguardian.com/science/2022/jul/28/stick-on-ultrasound-patch-revolution-medical-imaging](https://www.theguardian.com/science/2022/jul/28/stick-on-ultrasound-patch-revolution-medical-imaging)

**SPACE:** If you’re waiting for Martian samples to come back to Earth, aboard a rocket (instead of an asteroid), sounds like you will be waiting for another 11 years or so.

[https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/27/world/mars-sample-return-2033-scn/index.html](https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/27/world/mars-sample-return-2033-scn/index.html)

**CONSTRUCTION:** This one sounds pretty unreal and right out of a sci-fi movie, but MBS announced “The Line” earlier this week. It’s a 1600ft tall building that will also span 75 miles (!!!). The video suggests that it will be home to 9M residents and refers it to a “revolution in civilization”. With autonomous services, 20 minute end to end transportation and a planned zero carbon footprint, it’s really a moonshot type project.

[https://twitter.com/M7Alhamed/status/1551632353415630848?s=20&t=9JYoSYBixNrFTgQ3cqDAQA](https://twitter.com/M7Alhamed/status/1551632353415630848?s=20&t=9JYoSYBixNrFTgQ3cqDAQA)

**AI**: AlphaFold, the protein sequencing AI from Google’s DeepMind, has managed to uncovered the structure of 200,000,000 proteins from every organism that’s ever had its genome sequenced (including humans). *"Essentially, you can think of it as covering the entire protein universe. It includes predictive structures for plants, bacteria, animals, and many other organisms, opening up huge new opportunities for AlphaFold to have an impact on important issues, such as sustainability, food insecurity, and neglected diseases,"* said Demis Hassabis, DeepMind's founder and chief executive

[https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2022/jul/28/deepmind-uncovers-structure-of-200m-proteins-in-scientific-leap-forward#:\~:text=DeepMind%20uncovers%20structure%20of%20200m%20proteins%20in%20scientific%20leap%20forward,-Success%20of%20AlphaFold&text=Artificial%20intelligence%20has%20deciphered%20the,such%20as%20famine%20or%20pollution.](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2022/jul/28/deepmind-uncovers-structure-of-200m-proteins-in-scientific-leap-forward#:\~:text=DeepMind%20uncovers%20structure%20of%20200m%20proteins%20in%20scientific%20leap%20forward,-Success%20of%20AlphaFold&text=Artificial%20intelligence%20has%20deciphered%20the,such%20as%20famine%20or%20pollution.)

**SPACE:** China has its own space station and they just added a lab to it. I really can’t help but feel like the growing rift between the biggest nations in space is only hurting human civilization’s ability to progress. Just my take. But with [Russia also recently announcing it will quite the ISS program](https://www.rte.ie/news/world/2022/0726/1312325-international-space-station/), International space cooperation isn’t a happy place right now.

[https://phys.org/news/2022-07-china-science-laboratory-orbiting-space.html](https://phys.org/news/2022-07-china-science-laboratory-orbiting-space.html)

**HEALTH:** A cure for baldness?? Well, not quite yet, but scientists have found that the stem cell reservoir of the hair folicle is never destroyed and think there may be a way to activate it. Not only does this point to potential reversals of hair loss, it points to possible solutions for a variety of other health problems.

[https://news.ucr.edu/articles/2022/07/25/chemical-controlling-life-and-death-hair-follicles](https://news.ucr.edu/articles/2022/07/25/chemical-controlling-life-and-death-hair-follicles)

**AI:** An AI model decided to take its own path and used novel laws of physics to describe things. Essentially, AI created a new physics that is just as accurate as the physics we use today, but just a little different.

[https://scitechdaily.com/artificial-intelligence-discovers-alternative-physics/](https://scitechdaily.com/artificial-intelligence-discovers-alternative-physics/)

title: Decentralized Music Label
body:
Phlote (pronounced "float") is a DECENTRALIZED MUSIC LABEL built to reward talent discovery and directly support artists using NFTs.

We’ve built technology that allows us to scale our ability to identify, invest in, and amplify talented emerging artists alongside partners that include independent labels, creator focused blockchain protocols, and early fans. 

Our process for finding music relies on a passionate community of music lovers who select which songs we release using a process that’s open and transparent. We offer artists a straightforward deal structure that’s available to any artist and bypasses the power dynamics, politics, and barriers of the traditional music industry. 

To unlock the power of the internet for artists, we’re formed to allow anyone with an internet connection and crypto wallet to contribute to help discover and invest in the next generation of stars. 

The problem is…

Nearly all artists rely on streaming revenue as their primary means of income.  Without skills, resources, or means to tour or make high quality merch, artists must make ends meet on $.0003 per stream, a challenge that’s nearly impossible to overcome. 

To put things into perspective, a recording artists must cut through 80,000 songs that are uploaded to Spotify every day and generate one million streams to earn enough money to pay one month’s rent. With streaming, artists must gain visibility and then reach scale to have a chance to make a living. 

This is why many artists seek to sign deals with record labels. The only music made visible to fans on digital streaming platforms (DSPs) is sponsored by the three big labels that dominate the music industry, making them inhospitable places for independent acts, regardless of their level of talent. 

Fans are not immune…

Early fans break artists across social media every day, but have no way to be compensated for the work they do. The most passionate fans helps elevate emerging artist out of obscurity and onto the radar of editorial outlets and eventually labels. Think about the DJ, who spends much of her time finding obscure music to introduce to an audience, effectively helping to break new music. There’s tremendous value early tastemakers deliver to the music ecosystem, although they have historically been unable to capture much of it. Music labels are the only parties positioned to profit from discovery and are increasing relying on fans to generate the signal they use as the new A&R. 

What if we built a system that allowed artists to capture the value they create for billions of fans? What if early fans were fairly compensated for value they create as well?

All of this is possible with blockchain technology and non-fungible tokens (NFTs) - digital deeds that give any piece of digital content scarcity on the internet. The emergence of NFTs has created a global market for music that’s liquid, expanding, and favors up and coming artists. Now there’s a way to design skin-in-the-game incentives that allow artists to get paid a non-commoditized price for their work and for fans to profit from discovering new artists and helping them break.

In the old world, labels provided the capital and distribution.  Those resources can now be offered to artists, in part, by their super fans. Decentralized labels can enable this by using two components:

1. Decentralized Curation Protocol (voting)
2. Decentralized Marketplace (monetization)
3. Distribution (music sharing)

Decentralized Curation - At the foundation of Phlote is a curation protocol that rewards curators who are able to identify good music as voted on peer-to-peer. 

Our music curation process relies on a global community of music lovers who decide the music we sell as NFTs in exchange for a share of proceeds from NFT sales. The curation engine capitalizes on the public nature of blockchains to create a system that’s 100% transparent, permissionless and globally accessible to anyone with an internet connection and crypto wallet to participate in. 

Decentralized Marketplace - Breaking new artists now requires finding hundreds of fans versus millions and is likely to happen on marketplaces as much as it happens on streaming platforms. Number of transactions is the new follower count. 

For a decentralized label, the marketplace serves two functions. The marketplace is how the community monetizes it’s taste in music and enables artists to identify their core fans.  

By connecting our curation protocol to Zora’s decentralized marketplace protocol, we’ve created a pathway for any artist to mint music on the Ethereum blockchain without the restriction of gas fees. The bridge will allow for curation on [phlote.xyz](http://phlote.xyz/) to automatically launch NFT auctions on Zora, protocol-to-protocol. Phlote operates a custom contract that directs funds automatically to curators and artists. The DAO’s share of the sales proceeds is recirculated to the DAO treasury and used to fund fees for future artists.

Distribution (music sharing). Once an album is upvoted through the curation protocol, and sold on Zora, the next step is to amplify the artist and music. Today, the best interest of the artists and early supporters to look to traditional distribution platforms as the best place to reach a mass audience because that’s where they exist. Youtube and streaming platforms are utilized to serve as marketing for digital assets that exist on the blockchain. A wholly owned terrestrial radio station placed as distribution on top of a label would be powerful. Trad radio is a space that’s undervalued to new media/social media platforms, but for music continues to hold high value and cultural significance.  

Music social media is an interesting way to conceptualize what decentralized distribution could look like that takes advantage of music ownership as status, music collection as connective tissue, and the power of human recommendations over algorithms.  Imagine a social music network where each user’s profile is a playlist. 

We foresee a future where all next gen media networks are designed to be powered by the human recommendations of their community using the components discussed above. Using blockchain technology to combine community curation, ownership, distribution unlocks the global power of the internet for artists and enables a new class of participants to create, curate, and invest in media and IP for the first time ever.

title: SeeDAO治理工程师第13题-SeeDAO社区金库管理(上)
body:
本文分成上下文，上文先回顾了加密世界中DAO金库的起源和发展。下文针对SeeDAO金库目前的当前状况和遇到问题，提出一些建议和意见。


---

## 一.DAO金库的起源

2013年，最早线上分布式公司，DAC(Distributed Autonomous Corporation)概念由Daniel Larimer(EOS，Bitshare创始人) [最先提出](https://letstalkbitcoin.com/is-bitcoin-overpaying-for-false-security)。

2014年5月，在此基础上，V神特意写了一篇博文，发布在以太坊基金会官方博客上《[DAOs, DACs, DAs and More: An Incomplete Terminology Guide](https://blog.ethereum.org/2014/05/06/daos-dacs-das-and-more-an-incomplete-terminology-guide/)》。

**直到2016年4月，DAO金库正式出现。**

在Slock.it团队主要成员策划下，以太坊主网上首个风险投资型DAO诞生，背后理念就是用户投入Eth代币，换取The DAO的代币。DAO代币的作用，投票决定潜在项目方是否能被金库里的以太币投资。The DAO上线短短时间内，就筹集了价值1.5亿美元，数量超过1200万个Eth币。最后，因为一个代码漏洞，导致The DAO金库被盗和以太坊不得已硬分叉来解决这问题。

2017-2019年，[Aragon](https://twitter.com/AragonProject)、[DAOstack](https://daostack.io)、 [Moloch DAO](https://molochdao.com/)、[The LAO](https://www.thelao.io/)等多个服务DAO的工具，DAO孵化器出现，依旧在DAO路上不断探索。

2020年，DeFi Summer的出现，让蓝筹DeFi协议，如Uniswap, Maker, Compound收获了可观的手续费，充实了自家DAO金库，DAO金库的概念正式得以普及。

截止到2022年中旬，7月当前DAO金库控制的资金高达110亿美元各类资产。

![Source:https://pro.nansen.ai/dao-paradise](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iKfzhnkADMd8CG2YeNRyg.png?height=827&width=1590)

## 二.DAO金库的管理

随着DAO金库的不断壮大，如何更好的利用金库中的资产，成为了一个问题。不少DAO金库设置专人或者子DAO来管理庞大的社区金库资产。DAO金库的资产管理，方法论应运而生。

最重要的一篇研究文献，是2021年10月，Uncommoncore的Hasu发表的《一种用于DeFi金库新的心智模型([a-new-mental-model-for-defi-treasuries](https://uncommoncore.co/a-new-mental-model-for-defi-treasuries/))》。

在文章中主要研究Maker DAO**低效的金库资产管理**以及**主要蓝筹DeFi协议原生代币占比过大**。

![Case study:Maker DAO](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/I-UmdgDe2c7H9Iu46khbm.png?height=703&width=1116)

在MKR代币市场价格高的时候，MakerDAO花大量资金回购MKR代币。当MKR币价低迷之时，被迫出售代币换取稳定币资产，完成不良资产清算。这样高买低卖，实际是对MKR代币长期价值的损害。文章最后给出了一些DAO金库资产管理的建议：

* 金库资产管理，应该以最大化代币持有人的长期利益为主。
* 金库管理应该要考虑加密市场牛熊周期性。
* 金库管理应该要逆币价周期调节，即牛市高卖，熊市低价回购。
* 金库资产应该多元化，尤其是大部分金库资产都是原生Native Token，应该有足够的稳定币资产。
* 金库资产投资，要尽量发挥每1美元最大效用，在选择回购，投资蓝筹加密资产（BTC，Eth），储蓄，或者给Token持有人分红。

## 三.DAO金库管理的发展

随着以太坊上DAO组织爆炸式发展，各种各样的DAO都涌现了出来，有风投DAO，游戏公会DAO，DeFi协议DAO，NFT收藏家DAO，媒体DAO等等。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lc994sr3eUPrprLh4bmAz.png?height=892&width=1587)

大量DAO出现，帮助新兴的DAO金库管理工具，也迎来了春天。比如DAO金库使用最多的多签工具-**[Genosis](https://twitter.com/gnosisSafe)**。DAO金库每一笔开支花费，都要在**[Snapshot](https://twitter.com/SnapshotLabs)** 上发帖，成员投票通过确认。甚至自动帮DAO成员发放薪酬，比如

## 四.DAO金库管理的未来

当前所有DAO金库都面临一个严重的问题，即Native Token原生资产占比过大，考虑到加密市场周期性，原生Token的高波动性(能涨跌50%-90%)，DAO金库资产账面价值在熊市里十分容易大幅缩水。

如何解决这个问题，其中最重要的一个DAO金库管理方向是：金库资产多元化。

title: 第六章 预言成真
body:
前情提要：程聪跟随曲甄一家参加展佛节，高僧益西堪布对他说了一句没头没尾的“福祸相依”。随后，程聪和曲甄一家前往观看西域戏剧表演，正在上演的剧目是《文君公主》。

\*\*\*\*\*\*

文君公主是西域乃至苍国非常出名的一个历史人物，根据她的故事改编的戏剧也是西域戏的经典之一。

历史上，苍国中央政府和边陲游牧少数民族的关系一直时好时坏，经常兵戎相见。一千多年前，当时的苍国中央政府汤朝为了加深和西域少主松赞之间的关系，缓解两国的军事摩擦，册封了一名宗亲之女为文君公主，嫁给松赞和亲。

文君公主聪慧美丽、知书达礼，极其成功地完成了和亲使命。她和亲后的两百年内，西域与汤朝间没有发生过任何军事冲突，经济、文化交流大幅加强。文君公主还将汤朝先进的耕作、纺织、医药等技术带到了西域，为提升西域民众的生活水平做出了很大贡献，一直深受西域民众爱戴。

《文君公主》里编排精美的舞蹈和歌曲、周边观众热烈的欢呼声，虽然是第一次看传统西域戏剧，程聪也看得津津有味。

看着看着，程聪心里不禁将戏剧套入了现实。程聪的爸爸是苍国后裔，大学毕业后才去的星条国。有一半的苍国血统，程聪一直被苍国和星条国剑拔弩张的关系深深困扰。

从小就爱看历史书，程聪虽然明白弱肉强食、兴衰交替的“丛林法则”，但总觉得身处二十一世纪中叶，科技文明已高度发达，可叹人类社会、国家间却如同几千年前一样，被最基本的人性所支配，一如既往地明争暗斗、尔虞我诈，而原本希望能够协调各国的联合国已经沦为了一个空架子。

“有没有什么机制能够真正超越国家、协调全球呢？”程聪苦思着。

时间过得很快，转眼太阳已经快下山了。程聪他们离开了罗林卡公园，驾车回家休息。

可能是穿越回来身体的疲累终于发作了，也可能是昨晚没有没有睡好，这天晚上程聪睡得挺香。

第二天早上，吃完了早餐，曲甄问程聪要不要和她一起去几十公里外的羊卓湖写生。程聪还没思考出如何赚钱回星条国，也想去西域圣湖之一的羊卓湖看看，就欣然答应了。

羊卓湖属于高原堰塞湖，面积约600平方公里，湖里还有二十个小岛。被誉为世界上最美丽的水，羊卓湖碧蓝如洗，并集高原湖泊、雪山、岛屿、牧场、寺庙、野生动植物等多种景观为一体，景色如画，美得令人窒息。

羊卓湖的西侧有海拔7000多米的宁金峰，是一座常年雪山。来自雪山、冰川已经全部融化的年代，程聪不禁利用这个机会再次一饱眼福。

写生时，曲甄告诉程聪，她曾经想过去沿海或者外国读书，也向往过大城市的繁华生活，但每次看着羊卓湖和宁金峰，感觉这里才是她的心灵港湾，自己有责任留下来守护家乡。

程聪不忍告诉她没几十年她的家乡也会受到全球气候变化的影响而大变样，心里有些惆怅。

他们一直待到下午三点多。对今天的作品非常满意，曲甄开心地驾车载着程聪回家。

曲甄的家依山而建，从羊卓湖回来的公路上远远就能看到她家。“咦，你家门口好像停了很多车？”程聪不经意发现了些异常。曲甄仔细眺望了一下，诧异道：“是有些奇怪，从来没见过我家门口停这么多车。”

程聪突然想起了昨天在扎伦布寺高僧益西堪布对他说过的“福祸相依”。程聪隐隐有点不好的预感，想了一下，对曲甄说：“能麻烦你一件事么？”

“什么事，你说。”曲甄回道。

“我这里有一块智能电子手表，虽然出了些问题，但里面有一些我的个人资料，能麻烦你帮我暂时保管么？如果我离开或者需要的时候，我会再找你拿回。因为有我一些个人的财务信息，也请帮我保密。”程聪恳求曲甄。

程聪心里真实的想法是这个智能装置是自己从2049年穿越回来的重要线索，一定要保存、保密好，说不定会有重要的作用。

“为什么你突然要将手表交给我保管？你是不是怀疑那些人会对你不利?”曲甄问道。没等程聪回答，曲甄又问道：“那你要不要先避一下？等我先去看看情况？”

程聪知道之前自己说的黑恶势力借口是编的，心里实在不清楚这些车子是不是和自己有关，盘算了一下，自己现在实在有点前路渺茫，还是需要曲甄的帮助，于是回复曲甄：“没关系，我还是和你一起回家，我不相信西域的黑恶势力胆子有这么大。你暂时帮我保管手表就好，以防万一。”

曲甄点了点头，说：“我父亲毕竟曾经也是知名企业家，各方面也有不少朋友，我相信他们不敢这么嚣张追过来。手表你放心，我暂时帮你保管。”说完，接过程聪递过来的那块似乎是智能手表的电子装置，将车临时停靠了在路边，将它藏在了装千斤顶的工具盒里。然后，曲甄才重新上了车往家里开。

因为门口停了六七辆公务车，曲甄的车无法开进院子，停在了门口。这时，曲甄的爸爸多吉和十几个身着便衣中青年男子一起走了过来。

与多吉并排走的一个中年男子，似乎是这群人的领导。他身着灰色Polo衫和深蓝色休闲裤，在距离程聪一米外停了下来，神情谨慎地看着程聪，问道：“你是程聪?”

程聪答道：“我是。你们是？”

中年男子没有直接回复程聪，反而对程聪说：“请你出示你的身份证件和西域通行许可证。”

程聪判断这些人应该是政府机构的，不敢用之前向曲甄解释的黑恶势力借口，只是简短回答道：“我的身份证件不见了。”

“对不起，请你跟我们走一趟。”中年男子对程聪说道。这时，他身后走过来两名青年男子，左右夹住了程聪，带他向一辆公务车走去。

程聪无奈，一时也想不到应对的办法，把心一横，心想：“既来之，则安之。他们也不能把我怎么样，说不定还正好遣返我回星条国。”

想罢，程聪也不挣扎，转身随着两名青年男子向一辆公务车走去，并回头向曲甄苦笑了一下，算是告别。

没走两步，就听背后传来了中年男子的声音：“谢谢您及时通知我们，我们先走了。”

程聪虽然背对着中年男子和多吉，没看到具体的对话神情，但心里已经明白，看来多吉还是怀疑自己，所以通知了相关政府部门。

“福祸相依，我明白了……曲甄是福，多吉是祸……”程聪一边琢磨着，一边坐进了公务车。

title: SeeDAO治理工程师第13题-SeeDAO社区金库管理(上)
body:
本文分成上下文，上文先回顾了加密世界中DAO金库的起源和发展。下文针对SeeDAO金库目前的当前状况和遇到问题，提出一些建议和意见。


---

## 一.DAO金库的起源

2013年，最早线上分布式公司，DAC(Distributed Autonomous Corporation)概念由Daniel Larimer(EOS，Bitshare创始人) [最先提出](https://letstalkbitcoin.com/is-bitcoin-overpaying-for-false-security)。

2014年5月，在此基础上，V神特意写了一篇博文，发布在以太坊基金会官方博客上《[DAOs, DACs, DAs and More: An Incomplete Terminology Guide](https://blog.ethereum.org/2014/05/06/daos-dacs-das-and-more-an-incomplete-terminology-guide/)》。

**直到2016年4月，DAO金库正式出现。**

在Slock.it团队主要成员策划下，以太坊主网上首个风险投资型DAO诞生，背后理念就是用户投入Eth代币，换取The DAO的代币。DAO代币的作用，投票决定潜在项目方是否能被金库里的以太币投资。The DAO上线短短时间内，就筹集了价值1.5亿美元，数量超过1200万个Eth币。最后，因为一个代码漏洞，导致The DAO金库被盗和以太坊不得已硬分叉来解决这问题。

2017-2019年，[Aragon](https://twitter.com/AragonProject)、[DAOstack](https://daostack.io)、 [Moloch DAO](https://molochdao.com/)、[The LAO](https://www.thelao.io/)等好几个服务DAO的工具，DAO孵化器依旧在DAO路上不断探索。

2020年，DeFi Summer的出现，让蓝筹DeFi协议，如Uniswap, Maker, Compound收获了可观的手续费，充实了自家DAO金库，DAO金库的概念正式得以普及。

截至到2022年年，7月当前DAO金库控制的资金高达110亿美元各类资产。

## 二.DAO金库的管理

随着DAO金库的不断壮大，如何更好的利用金库中的资产，成为了一个问题。不少DAO金库设置专人或者子DAO来管理庞大的社区金库资产。DAO金库的资产管理，方法论应运而生。

最重要的一篇研究文献，是2021年10月，Uncommoncore的Hasu发表的《一种用于DeFi金库新的心智模型([a-new-mental-model-for-defi-treasuries](https://uncommoncore.co/a-new-mental-model-for-defi-treasuries/))》。

在文章中主要研究Maker DAO**低效的金库资产管理**以及**主要蓝筹DeFi协议原生代币占比过大**。

![Case study:Maker DAO](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/I-UmdgDe2c7H9Iu46khbm.png?height=703&width=1116)

在MKR代币市场价格高的时候，MakerDAO花大量资金回购MKR代币。当MKR币价低迷之时，被迫出售代币换取稳定币资产，完成不良资产清算。这样高买低卖，实际是对MKR代币长期价值的损害。文章最后给出了一些DAO金库资产管理的建议：

* 金库资产管理，应该以最大化代币持有人的长期利益为主。
* 金库管理应该要考虑加密市场牛熊周期性。
* 金库管理应该要逆币价周期调节，即牛市高卖，熊市低价回购。
* 金库资产应该多元化，尤其是大部分金库资产都是原生Native Token，应该有足够的稳定币资产。
* 金库资产投资，要尽量发挥每1美元最大效用，在选择回购，投资蓝筹加密资产（BTC，Eth），储蓄，或者给Token持有人分红。

## 三.DAO金库管理的发展

随着以太坊上DAO组织爆炸式发展，各种各样的DAO都涌现了出来，有风投DAO，游戏公会DAO，DeFi协议DAO，NFT收藏家DAO，媒体DAO等等。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lc994sr3eUPrprLh4bmAz.png?height=892&width=1587)

大量DAO出现，帮助新兴的DAO金库管理工具，也迎来了春天。比如DAO金库使用最多的多签工具-**[Genosis](https://twitter.com/gnosisSafe)**。DAO金库每一笔开支花费，都要在**[Snapshot](https://twitter.com/SnapshotLabs)** 上发帖，成员投票通过确认。甚至自动帮DAO成员发放薪酬，比如

## 四.DAO金库管理的未来

当前所有DAO金库都面临一个严重的问题，即Native Token原生资产占比过大，考虑到加密市场周期性，原生Token的高波动性(能涨跌50%-90%)，DAO金库资产账面价值在熊市里十分容易大幅缩水。

如何解决这个问题，其中最重要的一个DAO金库管理方向是：金库资产多元化。

* 指数化产品，帮助DAO金库一键式多样化金库资产：[Indexcoop](https://twitter.com/indexcoop), [Set protocol](https://www.tokensets.com/), [PieDAO](https://twitter.com/PieDAO_DeFi)

title: Would You Like To Mine One Bitcoin? Install 106 kW Of Solar Power.
body:
I know, this statement might sound way too simplistic; let me elaborate and provide you with some details of my back-of-the-envelope calculation.

As of March 24, 2022, the Bitcoin network hash rate is around 201 ExaHash per second (EH/s). Explained in lay terms a hash is a complex mathematical operation. 201 ExaHash is equal to 201 followed by 18 zeros, which is a pretty high number of complex mathematical operations per second. It represents the computational power provided by all bitcoin miners globally.

If you want to mine bitcoins you need a very unique piece of equipment; specifically you need an ASIC miner. This piece of hardware is characterized by hash rate and energy consumption. One of the models available in the market is the Antminer S19 Pro, which features:

* A hash rate of 110 TeraHash per second (TH/s);
* A power consumption of 3,250 Watts (W).

Knowing that new blocks in the bitcoin blockchain are mined every 10 minutes, for which the miner receives a reward of 6.25 bitcoin, we can estimate that 900 new bitcoins are mined per day.

As stated above, global calculation power available is 201 EH/s. Based upon this number we can then estimate that app. 19,300 EH are required to mine one bitcoin.

With your brand new Antminer S19 Pro you enjoy a hash rate of 110 TH/s. A single unit will need slightly over five and a half years to mine one bitcoin (5.6 years).

Assuming your hardware is working at full capacity for 5.6 years, and knowing that it requires 3,250 W to operate, 158 megawatts-hour (MWh) of electricity will be consumed before mining your first bitcoin.

If you are kind of a geek like me and enjoy making calculations that involve renewable energy, you might be wondering whether it makes sense to feed your mining operations with solar power.

Let's say you can install a 106 kW solar PV plant with a specific production of 1,500 equivalent hours (eq.h). This plant will be generating 159,000 kWh a year, theoretically enough to mine your first bitcoin.

However, so far you have a single Antminer unit plugged into the solar plant, mining 1,500 hours per year. This is enough to produce 594 EH, or 0.03 bitcoins. In the process it will have consumed 4,875 kWh, leaving most of the generation output of the solar plant available.

I assume that you'd rather want your first bitcoin sooner than later, so obviously you need to scale up your operations and acquire more Antminers. Let's say you want to mine one bitcoin in one year. Then you need to connect 32.5 Antminers to your 106 kW solar plant so that 100% of the generation output is utilized for mining.

It might sound cool but... does it make economic sense to build a solar plant to mine bitcoins? I will be exploring this question in a future post.

* [agilibus.es](http://agilibus.es/)

title: SeeDAO治理工程师第13题-社区金库管理(上)
body:
本文分成上下文，上文先回顾了加密世界中DAO金库的起源和发展。下文针对SeeDAO金库目前的当前状况和遇到问题，提出一些建议和意见。


---

## 一.DAO金库的起源

2013年，最早线上分布式公司，DAC(Distributed Autonomous Corporation)概念由Daniel Larimer(EOS，Bitshare创始人) [最先提出](https://letstalkbitcoin.com/is-bitcoin-overpaying-for-false-security)。

2014年5月，在此基础上，V神特意写了一篇博文，发布在以太坊基金会官方博客上《[DAOs, DACs, DAs and More: An Incomplete Terminology Guide](https://blog.ethereum.org/2014/05/06/daos-dacs-das-and-more-an-incomplete-terminology-guide/)》。

**直到2016年4月，DAO金库正式出现。**

在Slock.it团队主要成员策划下，以太坊主网上首个风险投资型DAO诞生，背后理念就是用户投入Eth代币，换取The DAO的代币。DAO代币的作用，投票决定潜在项目方是否能被金库里的以太币投资。The DAO上线短短时间内，就筹集了价值1.5亿美元，数量超过1200万个Eth币。最后，因为一个代码漏洞，导致The DAO金库被盗和以太坊不得已硬分叉来解决这问题。

2017-2019年，[Aragon](https://twitter.com/AragonProject)、[DAOstack](https://daostack.io)、 [Moloch DAO](https://molochdao.com/)、[The LAO](https://www.thelao.io/)等多个服务DAO的工具，DAO孵化器出现，依旧在DAO路上不断探索。

2020年，DeFi Summer的出现，让蓝筹DeFi协议，如Uniswap, Maker, Compound收获了可观的手续费，充实了自家DAO金库，DAO金库的概念正式得以普及。

截止到2022年中旬，7月当前DAO金库控制的资金高达110亿美元各类资产。

![Source:https://pro.nansen.ai/dao-paradise](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iKfzhnkADMd8CG2YeNRyg.png?height=827&width=1590)

## 二.DAO金库的管理

随着DAO金库的不断壮大，如何更好的利用金库中的资产，成为了一个问题。不少DAO金库设置专人或者子DAO来管理庞大的社区金库资产。DAO金库的资产管理，方法论应运而生。

最重要的一篇研究文献，是2021年10月，Uncommoncore的Hasu发表的《一种用于DeFi金库新的心智模型([a-new-mental-model-for-defi-treasuries](https://uncommoncore.co/a-new-mental-model-for-defi-treasuries/))》。

在文章中主要研究Maker DAO**低效的金库资产管理**以及**主要蓝筹DeFi协议原生代币占比过大**。

title: 「所謂的喜歡」給香港圈個圈
body:
一個人 從內至外 
 相信由許多因素造就 
 若排除本體部分 
 區域範圍內集合的人與物 
 及特色的餐飲文化 等等... 
 薈聚而形成空氣裡的獨有味道 
 所以處於不同城市邊界 
 就能明顯感受分差 
 *“當地人”該有著這層意味*

 
 而我有許多欣賞的人 
 若非要扯上人盡皆知的名號 
 有迪麗熱巴 劉詩詩 周杰倫 
  
 但我並不熟悉港星 
 哪怕當時在TVB工作 
 於餐廳或其他角落相遇 
 也都是在同事的提醒之下 
  
 當然在與港星做同事的期間 
 會發現很少人 主動索取合照 
 背後原因是 為不阻礙他人休息 
 所以只有年宴上 
 才會採取 進一步行動 
 可湊熱鬧的人始終徘徊 
 只是在香港 大家可能更關注自己的節奏 
 例外也有 譬如“MIRROR” 
 這個男團組合其實就是港版內娛選秀而出 
  
 不盡相同的是 
 “MIRROR”成員的出身 
 大多沒有內娛成員的華麗背景 
 他們真實 傳遞“素人”非凡 
 給予很多很多年輕人能量 
  
 到目前為止 
 即使我心知一些追星者也瘋狂 
 我也願意承認 
 “MIRROR”真實一面的輸出 
 是絕對具有意義的

不過你會發現 
 在百度search“MIRROR”或者“COLLAR” 
 並沒有相關的組團新聞 
  
 可你知 
 主流的港媒hk01 
 甚至專門開了一個以“MIRROR”為名的資訊欄 
 這該足以證明他們的熱度了吧 
  
 從此便知道 
 借憑印象就想定義對一個城市的理解 
 遠遠不夠 
 這也適用於人 
  
 COVID物理限制下 
 輿論更是層出不窮 
 因為除了ONLINE 
 似乎找不到途徑消遣 
 但這恰恰中了“科技圈套” 
 至少一部分是這般

*咳咳* 
 *差異永遠存在*

title: How to Make Profits in the Metaverse Part 1 Decentraland
body:
Most of us think that NFTs are the empowerment of people coming together to create a strong community. As we see in history, we have never had a social organization across the borders, touching many countries as today. Non Fungible Tokens are a combination of identity and social organization with no politics, racial parameters, or rules established by someone else (a.k.a. Governments/politicians), and even inclusivity. No one will judge by the way you interact or even how you dress your avatar.

Every NFT holder can interpret their own meaning of the community they belong to, and the group has broadly coordinated goals, and that is how the roadmap is completed.

NFTs are a class of real-life solutions like ETH and Bitcoin, but a little bit looser and more abstract than the two mentioned earlier.

So, what with the metaverse? The metaverse brings a landscape for NFT holders and a platform to interact with the community virtually but in real-time. This is where the virtual lands come to play.

People are passionate about property rights…The famous “YOU HAVE TO INVEST ON REAL ESTATE” (not financial advice) comes from this idea. I believe that the feeling of ownership fits well with most people.

The goal of an NFT project is to ensure you have property rights in a digital asset. The same applies to digital real estate. I mean that you are not a serf on someone else’s property in the non physical world.

As we see the Metaverse landscaping keep growing, it might be a little bit confusing for people. We see Centralized companies like Meta (also known as Facebook) and Roblox pursuing this industry and some VCs.

Here are the decentralized main platforms and how users can take profit from each of them:

## Decentraland

Decentraland is a decentralized virtual reality platform based on the ERC-20 network. The perfect analogy would be that Decentraland is the “Sims” of NFTs.

The platform is regulated by a DAO, so through the communication > proposals of the community > voting, the roadmap is scheduled and accomplished. [Trello’s website](https://trello.com/b/YZnGNh5z/decentraland-roadmap-2022-and-beyond) offers a dynamic roadmap based on the DAO’s votation and proposals, and it is worth taking a look.

![Decentraland Avatars. Source: Decentraland ](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Wf2qg2CpfSMZaZ2mMp_7H.png?height=466&width=672)

### Token

$MANA is the platform’s token. This coin has some good utilities like: voting on the DAO proposals, buying digital items for your avatar, and buying land plots. You can also stake $MANA on[ Celsius](https://celsius.network/), [Gemini](https://www.gemini.com/), and [Crypto.com](https://crypto.com/).

Good things about Decentraland is that they are very transparent with their balance sheets and information is very clear on the [website](https://governance.decentraland.org/transparency/).

You can acquire $MANA through a CEX (Centralized Exchange) like Binance, FTX, Coinbase, among others. The other way around is with a DEX (Decentralized Exchange) of ERC - 20 tokens, like UniSwap or SushiSwap.

### How to make money on Descentraland

**Lands**

Lands are a highly valuable digital item among the metaverse. Lately, land is also known as Virtual Real Estate. Decentraland currently has  90,601 plots of land of 16 x 16 meters \[52 ft x 52 ft\] size.

By buying 2+ lands you can create an Estate, so you can start creating a bigger and bigger environment.

When you own a land or an Estate, you can start leasing them. Some users create ads in their own land to give themselves exposure to potential lessors. After first contact and getting a deal, the tenant starts to create the environment for the landlord with the specs required by them for the event to take place. There are some websites that offer smart contracts to rent your properties:

* [metaverse.properties](https://metaverse.properties/)
* [dclrenting](https://dclrenting.com/)
* [rentalbyl](http://rentabyl.com/)

Doing this gives you passive income without selling your properties. Most people rent their properties for galleries or fashion shows. [Here](https://events.decentraland.org/event/?id=00312267-7b7c-4fa9-8327-3d348066f12b) is an example of a fashion show in Decentraland.

If you are looking to trade your land, here are some graphics obtained from NFTGo.io:

![Decentraland Land. Holders & Traders. (Source: NFTGo.io)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uCKwsFw-22dxe_kInl8RJ.png?height=790&width=1244)

*Holders & Traders* shows how much people hold their lands. Its active months November - December and part of January are due to the ATH of the NFT industry and for the big exposure that Decentraland had in those months (brands started to have some collaborations with Decentraland).

![Decentraland Holder Trends since 2018. (Source: NFTGo.io)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/PejaokTsxXRhinlXUKEaN.png?height=816&width=1460)

As we can see on *Holder Trends,* holders have been increasing over time, and some “whale wallets” have joined the project lately. Having whale wallets on the project might be a good thing because high value investors are backing up the project.

![Decentraland. Holding Amount Distribution & Holding Period Distribution. Source: (NFTGo.io)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uB2DawagsVM109QmkggQL.png?height=796&width=2354)

Whale wallets are wallets that hold $1,000,000+ in digital assets.

*Holding Amount D*istribution & Holding Period Distribution shows how much investors are holding their lands. 80.4% of holders have been holding them for more than one year, which means that most people are not looking for a quick flip. This is interesting because, in the eyes of the investors, this is a long play. So, if you are looking to acquire land, you probably should go for the long term and not for a quick flip.

**Trading**

The other way to have some stream of revenue is from trading $MANA. Probably you should go and learn technical analysis to perform this and wait for hot news.

However, trading $MANA is not the only thing you can do. Since avatar’s items are also NFTs, you could trade wearables as well. *Market Cap & Volume* shows the volume in a 1-year range. Market Cap has increased over time because there are new wearable items, so because of it, Market Cap has increased. On the other side, the volume has been maintained steady.

![Decentraland, wearables. Market Cap & Volume. (Source: NFTGo.io)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/gff2LnSIepl5X4eBEstJF.png?height=830&width=2064)

![Decentraland, wearables. Holding Period Distribution. (Source: NFTGo.io)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/lrLwTgneRqxmC8Ml7ihgS.png?height=688&width=1034)

As the *Holding Period Distribution* shows, most holders hold their assets for a year or more. If you are looking for a quick flip, you might not get the full profit potential of the item. The best way to go is holding it for the long term.

**Content creators**

The good thing about Descentraland is that they offer 2 kinds of  [Builder](https://docs.decentraland.org/content-intro/) tools  for creators, which are:

* The Builder: The builder is the best  “starter pack” to get into the content creator side. This tool keeps things as simple as possible, pure creativity with a simple drag and drop editor. There are a lot of default items to work with.
* The Decentraland SDK: This tool is for advanced devs with skills in coding. Here, you will need to write your code to create your own scene. Because of this, imagination is the limit.

It is worth mentioning that you can use other 3rd party modeling tools to create your environment.

Once you choose which tools you want to use, here are some ways to make revenue as a creator:

* Sell digital items: Clothes, and accessories for your avatar. Publication fees at a flat cost of $500 (paid in $MANA) each. 
* Build mini-games with wearable items to sell as souvenirs!

### Metrics to measure how valuable a plot is

![Decentraland. Land map (Source: Decentraland)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Xy7QmtjBMGKYy2X3Z1MyN.png?height=379&width=866)

Looking at the map and selecting a land to purchase might be a little bit confusing. There are some metrics to take into consideration when you are buying a plot:

* Main avenues or secondary streets.
* If it is close to a Genesis Plaza (green boxes), you can see the example on the *Land Map.*
* Google trends.

![Decentraland. Google Trends, Worldwide. (Source: Google)](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/zza7vrrht2lcdsUlIaPKk.png?height=682&width=2264)

Google trends are a good measure to follow the people’s hype related to the project. If we compare *Holders Trends* with *Google Trends,* we will see some similarities in the interest of people and the volume of buyers and sellers.

Note: The above information is for informational purposes only. Investing in digital assets such as NFTs and cryptocurrency brings a high degree of risk. Please consult with a financial advisor before making any investment decisions. NFTGo.io does not provide financial advice and is not responsible for any losses from investing in digital assets.
